Clear example of bad naming.


"Let's Confuse Everyone"

  • Moths documentation
  • Server package
  • db_interface module

db_interface module¶

This module initiates server-database dialogue based on SqlAlchemy library. Main module class - ServerDB has 4 subclasses which describe separate db tables that store user activity records.

class ServerDB¶
class ActiveUsers(user_id, ip_address, port, login_time)
class AllUsers(username, password, fullname=None, email=None)
class Contacts(user_id)
class LoginHistory(name, date, ip, port)
active_users_list()¶

returns active user list

add_contact(username, other)¶

updates user client list (triggered by write_requests on server side whenever someone sends message to the other client)

fetch_contacts(username)¶

returns client’s current contact list

fetch_userhash(username)¶

returns client’s password hash to the server for client authentication

login_history(username=None)¶

returns login history

user_login(username, ip_address, port)¶

records client’s login action

user_logout(username)¶

records client’s logout action

user_register(username, password, fullname, email, ip_address, port)¶

creates new client record in a database

users_list()¶

returns a list of all clients
